result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M DeMarsh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Def posted $800 to DA trust fund for victim Pam Sperber. To pay another $700 to DA trust fund by 2/11/15. Total of $1500 to be paid for victim Pam Sperber.  Hearing on restitution, if any, for victim Pam Steffen to be held on 2/18/15 at 1:30pm. If restitution is found, amended JOC will be completed.

Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

no contact with Pam Steffen, or her work, residence, or thru electronic media.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants, other than being at work related business.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

Further proceedings on October 22, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel M DeMarsh in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver and binds matter over.  Information filed.    Defense waives reading of the information and enters a plea of not guilty. Status conference on September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel M DeMarsh in court with attorney Perry P. Lieuallen.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No contact with victims in any manner of victims in complaint, their residences or employment.

Defendant Daniel M DeMarsh in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. Def does not qualify for public defender, and will retain private counsel. State requests $10,000 cash with conditions.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
